meanings.definition: To increase the volume or power of something, especially sound.
meanings.sent1: She was amping up the music for the party.
meanings.sent2: The technician was amping the guitar before the concert.
meanings.sent3: The DJ kept amping the music, making everyone dance.
meanings.sent4: His words amped up the crowd like a powerful speaker.
meanings.sent5: The sound system amped the bass, shaking the room.

meanings.definition: To excite or energize someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The coach was amping the team before the big game.
meanings.sent2: The energetic music amped up the atmosphere of the party.
meanings.sent3: The surprise announcement amped the excitement in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm amped up the motivation of her friends.
meanings.sent5: The thrilling movie amped his adrenaline, keeping him on edge.

meanings.definition: The act of increasing the power or intensity of something.
meanings.sent1: The amping of the speakers made the music louder.
meanings.sent2: The amping of the lights created a dramatic effect on stage.
meanings.sent3: The sudden amping of the movie's volume startled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The amping of emotions in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The gradual amping of tension in the story kept readers engaged.
